article.headline: Bankrupt Hertz wants to sell up to $1 billion in stock
article.body: Bankrupt auto rental company Hertz Global Holdings HTZ, -1.78% wants to sell as much as $1 billion in stock to take advantage of its recent rally, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing the company's lawyers. The lawyers told the bankruptcy judge the rise in the stock price "present a unique opportunity." Hertz also wants permission to get out of leases for 144,372 vehicles, the report said. Hertz closed Thursday at $2.06.
